node.title: Protesters teargassed as they call for Solomon Islands PM to step down
node.alt: A large crowd looks up at Parliament House in Honiara.
node.description: Police in Solomon Islands useÂ tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse large crowds that turned out in the capital Honiara this afternoon, demanding the country's Prime Minister step down.
node.content:
["Police in Solomon Islands have used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse large crowds that turned out in the capital Honiara this afternoon\u00a0demanding the resignation of Prime Minister\u00a0Manasseh Sogavare.", "The demonstration was linked to an ongoing issue between the national government and a provincial government\u00a0which has refused to recognise China.", "Almost 1,000 people gathered at the gates of parliament where MPs are currently sitting.", "Buildings were stoned and a traditional leaf hut next to Parliament House went up in flames.", "Those on the ground describe the situation as \"tense\", and schools in the city closed early.", "", "
Black\u00a0smoke billows from a burning leaf hut.(Twitter: @ginakekea)
", "The Solomon Islands Herald reported that protesters later looted and damaged shops in Honiara's Chinatown, and marched to the Chinese\u00a0embassy.", "Beijing opened an embassy in Honiara last September, after the Solomon Islands shifted its diplomatic ties from Taiwan to mainland China.", "The ABC has been told that the Australian government\u00a0is preparing to respond to any requests for support from Solomon Islands.", "The Royal Solomon Islands Police Force has been contacted for comment.", "More to come."]
